Class StringExtensions

NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Extensions

Provides extension methods for string manipulation, particularly useful for cleaning and processing RSS/Atom feed content.

public static class StringExtensions

Remarks

This static class contains utility extensions for common string operations in the RSS reader domain, such as HTML tag removal for safe summary generation and content preview.

All methods are designed to be null-safe, performant, and suitable for processing potentially malformed feed data from external sources.

Performance note: Methods use compiled regular expressions where applicable to minimize overhead on repeated calls (e.g., during feed parsing).

Methods

StripHtml(string?)

Removes all HTML tags from the input string and trims whitespace, producing a plain-text version.

public static string StripHtml(this string? input)

Parameters

input string

The input string potentially containing HTML markup (e.g., from RSS description or content).

Returns

string

A clean plain-text string with all HTML tags removed and normalized whitespace; never null.

Examples

string dirty = "Hello &nbsp; world! <script>alert(1)</script>";
string clean = dirty.StripHtml(); // Returns: "Hello  world! alert(1)"

Remarks

This method is optimized for RSS/Atom feed summaries and descriptions: - Strips all HTML tags using a compiled regex - Replaces common non-breaking spaces (&nbsp;) with regular spaces - Normalizes line breaks to single spaces - Trims leading/trailing whitespace

Safe for large inputs: does not load full DOM or use heavy HTML parsers. Sufficient for most feed use cases; does not attempt to preserve formatting or handle malformed HTML perfectly.

Performance: Regex is compiled once at startup for fast repeated execution during feed sync.
